Former Governor Paul Cellucci dies at 65

Argeo Paul Cellucci, a Hudson native who rose to become governor of Massachusetts and ambassador to Canada, died at his home in Hudson this afternoon after a five-year battle with Lou Gehrig’s disease, according to two close family friends.
  • Pictures Cellucci through the years | Notable deaths of 2013 | Sign the guest book

Pittsburgh-area man arrested after B's win

Transit police said a man from Carnegie, Pa. assaulted another man outside of Sullivan Square station in Charlestown.
  • Share Are you a Bruins twin?
  • Buy Bruins tickets

Stranded dolphin released into Cape Bay

A 335-pound adult female Risso’s dolphin washed ashore in Osterville - possibly due to tropical storm Andrea, an official said.

Collins marches in Hub gay pride parade

NBA veteran Jason Collins marched in the parade with his former Stanford roommate Congressman Joe Kennedy III.
